intro: Spigelia beyrichiana var. breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered spigelia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. The flowers are typically pink to reddish in color and bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas.
